columns.book_club_id: A unique identifier for each entry in the book club, serving as the primary key.
columns.Year: The year in which the book was discussed within the book club.
columns.Author_or_Editor: The name of the author or editor of the book being discussed.
columns.Book_Title: The title of the book that was read and discussed by the book club.
columns.Publisher: The name of the publishing company that published the book.
columns.Category: The genre or category under which the book falls, such as types of fiction or non-fiction.
columns.Result: The outcome associated with the book, indicating whether it won an award, was nominated, or received another designation.

book_club.table_description: The book_club table stores information about the books read in a book club, including details such as the authors, publishers, categories, and results of their discussions or awards.

columns.movie_id: A unique identifier for each movie in the database.
columns.Title: The name of the movie.
columns.Year: The year in which the movie was released.
columns.Director: The name of the director responsible for the movie.
columns.Budget_million: The production budget of the movie, expressed in millions of dollars.
columns.Gross_worldwide: The total revenue generated by the movie worldwide.

movie.table_description: The movie table stores information about film productions, including identification, title, release year, director, budget, and worldwide gross revenue.

columns.Company_name: The name of the company operating in the culture sector.
columns.Type: The classification of the company, indicating its corporate structure or relationship within the group.
columns.Incorporated_in: The location where the company was legally established.
columns.Group_Equity_Shareholding: The percentage of ownership interest the parent company has in the subsidiary or joint venture.
columns.book_club_id: A reference identifier linking to associated book club activities or organizations.
columns.movie_id: A reference identifier linking to associated movie productions or entities.

culture_company.table_description: The culture_company table stores information about companies involved in cultural activities, including their structural type, place of incorporation, ownership stakes, and associations with books and movies.
